member.name: M:rainbowedit.Extensions.StringExtensions.GetSimilarity(System.String,System.String,System.StringComparer)
member.summary: Computes a value that indicates the similarity between two strings. "Similarity" is defined as the number of characters that are the same in both strings, divided by the length of the longer string. As such, the value returned by this method is always between 0 (the strings are have no characters in common) and 1 (the strings are equal), inclusive.
member.param: The first to use for the comparison.
The second to use for the comparison.
A instance to use when comparing the s. Defaults to .

member.name: T:rainbowedit.Operator
member.summary: Represents an in Siege.

member.name: T:rainbowedit.Operator.OperatorSpeed
member.summary: A series of constants containing the different movement speeds of an in in-game meters per second.
member.remarks:
The naming pattern of the fields is: SPEED_{rating}_{weapon}_{slow?}{stance}{aim?} where
rating: the rating, 3, 2 or 1,
weapon: the weight class of the being held, HEAVY or LIGHT,
slow?: a value indicating whether the slow-move key was being held for this measurement, SLOW or absent (always absent for {stance} == PRONE or {stance} == RUN,
stance: a value indicating which stance or movement "subtype" this measurement is for, PRONE, CROUCH, WALK or RUN and
aim?: a value indicating whether the measurement was made while ADS or not, _AIM or absent (always absent for {stance} == RUN).
As such, there are several invalid combinations that cannot exist, such as SPEED_3_HEAVY_RUN_AIM, SPEED_3_HEAVY_SLOWPRONE SPEED_3_LIGHT_SLOWRUN_AIM as the movement "subtypes" contradict each other.

member.name: F:rainbowedit.Operator.OperatorSpeed.SPEED_3_HEAVY_PRONE
member.summary: The prone speed of a 3 while having a heavy weapon (such as an Assault Rifle) equipped.

member.summary: The prone speed of a 3 while having a light weapon (such as a Pistol) equipped.

member.name: T:rainbowedit.Weapon.Collections
member.summary: Contains properties that return specific collections of s. Note that, at runtime, these evaluate correctly and return an of . The inherent issue with how the and, consequently, their s are instantiated are that the order in which static fields and properties are initialized is undefined. At compile-time, all the and fields/properties are , which makes them unusable for creating pre-defined collections of them. As such, these properties are evaluated lazily through .

member.name: F:rainbowedit.Weapon.SuppressedDamageMultiplier
member.summary: The multiplier that is applied to a weapon's base damage when equipping a on it. This is not defined anywhere and resulted from averaging the ratios from all weapons a can be equipped on (suppressed_dmg / dmg). Typically, using 0.84 yields a close enough approximate. The calculated value is then rounded towards the nearest integer.

summary.para: The multiplier that is applied to a weapon's base damage when equipping an on it. Defined as 15% on top of the 's base damage as part of the Y7S2 Designer's notes (https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/359550/view/5254045511872530857).
As of Y8S1.2, this has been changed to 12% on top of a 's base damage.

member.name: T:rainbowedit.Weapon.Sight
member.summary:
Indicates which sights can be or are forcefully equipped on a .
As of Y7S1, all weapons (excepting most secondaries and, for example, Glaz's "OTs-03" DMR, which does not have access to Reflex C) have access to all non-magnifying (1x) scopes (Red Dot, Holo, Reflex), or more precisely, all of their variants (no matter if standard, Russian, alternate etc.). Because of this, I've decided to combine them. Checking for magnifying scopes still works as before.
However, as mentioned above, exceptions such as Glaz's "OTs-03" DMR, which cannot be equipped with Reflex C, are not (yet?) handled differently.
Additionally, since there are two 2.5x scope variants, the two options for that magnification level have also been combined.
As of Y7S3, all weapons that have access to scopes of a specific magnification level now automatically have access to all magnifications levels up to that level (excepting Kali's "CSRX 300"). Because of this, the flags have been redefined to act as maximums. Use for any look-ups.
